column4: i thought build-essential installed the linker for you? gcc seems to be present before you install b-e
open synaptic and search for gcc
you can just tell me :) im a work, which means winXP
gcc is not installed by default some gcc apps are but the package gcc is not
okay, i see. i tried to compile something on a fresh ubuntu-install, but gcc reported "cant build executable files" - which led me to believe that gcc was there, but not the linker

http://www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/ch-source.html has information about build-essential. it does not in any way contain gcc, it simply instructs the system which programs/packages are needed to compile, link, etc.
prolly just me that misunderstood. sorry about that. a good page to read through anyhow.
no what one person doesnt know another might
still, that does not pertain to the definition of a question
does wav not stand for windows audio video anymore?
heh, yes, but it again is encoded in PCM, but I was trying to kind of abbreviate the level of information
no prob, he needs another run of it, heh
files ending with a ~ are usually emacs backups
